Key Match Events: The England vs Scotland match at the Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados, turned out to be a rain-affected affair
Scotland set England a 109-run (DLS) target but not a single ball could be bowled in the second innings
Openers Michael Jones and George Munsey shared an unbeaten 90-run partnership as Scotland scored 90 for no loss in their rain-shortened T20 World Cup opener against defending Champions England
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland won the toss and elected to bat
England were quite off with the ball! They just could not land it right and despite there being purchase off the surface, they failed to make most of it
Post-Match Reflections: The skipper of Scotland, Richie Berrington says that it is frustrating for everyone
The captain of England, Jos Buttler says he hopes for a dry day in their next game and that they get a full game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game has been abandoned due to rain
Both teams will share points and open their accounts in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, 2024
The revised target for England is 109
Scotlandâ€™s effort even after the rain break was a good one for them
They managed to add 39 runs in the 22 balls they had after the break
Others: The action does not stop here, though, as the other game of the day between the Netherlands and Nepal is underway in Dallas
Having bowled the Asian side out for 106, the Dutch are going along nicely in their batting effort and look set to give their NRR an early boost
